Posted By: RJDroid (5/31/2012 6:00:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is a good card. Not pointlessly overpowered, but with enough combo potential to make you want to seriously build a deck around him.  
Why didn't they make him something more characteristic of ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) though? Like a... er... Snake Rogue? I'm not exactly sure what he is. As far as I can tell, he's an Esperite who's gone native in a ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)-aligned shard. Or a a ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)-aligned native after becoming etheriumized. Who knows?  
Fun fact: this is one of the few ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) artifact creatures. As of writing this, the others are [Reaper King](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper King) and [Transguild Courier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Transguild Courier) (which are all colors anyway) and [Thundering Tanadon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thundering Tanadon) (which is an abomination anyway).
posts.html:
This is a good card. Not pointlessly overpowered, but with enough combo potential to make you want to seriously build a deck around him.
Why didn't they make him something more characteristic of though? Like a... er... Snake Rogue? I'm not exactly sure what he is. As far as I can tell, he's an Esperite who's gone native in a -aligned shard. Or a a -aligned native after becoming etheriumized. Who knows?
Fun fact: this is one of the few artifact creatures. As of writing this, the others are Reaper King and Transguild Courier (which are all colors anyway) and Thundering Tanadon (which is an abomination anyway).

posts.post_content: @RAV0004: From what I checked, none of the other cascade-3s are creatures. You're not including a cascade card JUST for the cascade, are you? (And yes, I realize that when they were first broached in Ice Age, part of the draw of cantrips was that they obliquely let the deck be less than 60 cards. I still don't think that justifies including a cantrip without regard for what the main effect actually is...)
posts.html:
